api_version.description:
Version of the information, and of the schema,
as two integers – [major, minor].
The minor version is increased on every change to the
schema that keeps backwards compatibility for forks
(i.e. input data).
The major version is increased on incompatible changes.

Version 0.x means incompatible changes may be done at any
time. Please coordinate your use of the API with us.

default_time.description: Default start and end time for sessions

derives.description: Slug of the course this derives from (deprecated)

description.description: Short description of the course (about one line).

edit_info.description:
Information about a repository where the content can be edited

Added in API version 0.4

end_date.description: Date when this course ends, or None

etag.description:
Optional string that should change when the course's content changes, similar to the HTTP ETag.
If missing from the input course, the etag may be generated by the naucse server.

long_description.description: Long description of the course (up to several paragraphs).

source_file.description: Path to a source file containing the page's text, relative to the repository root

start_date.description: Date when this course starts, or None

subtitle.description: Human-readable subtitle, mainly used to distinguish several runs of same-named courses.

time_description.description: Human-readable description of the time the course takes place (e.g. 'Wednesdays')

timezone.description:
Timezone for times specified without a timezone (i.e. as HH:MM (rather than HH:MM+ZZZZ). Mandatory if such times appear in the course.

Added in API version 0.3

A smaller collection of teaching materials

Usually used for one meeting of an in-preson course or
a self-contained section of a longer workshop.

date.description: The date when this session occurs (if it has a set time)

serial.description:
Human-readable string identifying the session's position
                in the course.
                The serial is usually numeric: `1`, `2`, `3`, ...,
                but, for example, i, ii, iii... can be used for appendices.
                Some courses start numbering sessions from 0.
            

Added in API version 0.1
